intro: Cryptandra leucophracta, commonly known as the white-fractured cryptandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Cryptandra leucophracta is an important species for local biodiversity and is often found in coastal and inland regions of its native range.
